title: Boris Johnson's next move: Making millions or a comeback?
description: As he steps down as prime minister, experts predict Boris Johnson will not be short of job offers.

title: Antigua's traditional bread shops struggle amid food price hikes
description: The much loved shops using have been hit hard - but are trying to keep customers happy.

title: Does Premier League have a problem using VAR after day of controversy?
description: Does the Premier League have a problem using VAR? Managers are left divided on a day of controversial calls.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'my summer'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Awkward moments and pitfalls on the Conservative campaign trail
description: Rishi Sunak or Liz Truss will be the new Conservative leader - watch the campaign's memorable moments.

title: Match of the Day analysis: Should 'magnificent' Ivan Toney play for England?
description: Match of the Day's Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy discuss Ivan Toney's England squad potential after the striker scored a hat-trick for Brentford during their 5-2 win over Leeds United.

title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant: Link lost to main power line
description: The UN nuclear watchdog says the Zaporizhzhia plant is now relying on a reserve line to supply power.

title: Natasha Jonas: Briton beats Patricia Berghult to become unified super-welterweight world champion
description: Natasha Jonas unifies the super-welterweight division by beating Patricia Berghult before a raucous home crowd at Liverpool's M&S Bank Arena.

title: Men's Hundred final: Trent Rockets beat Manchester Originals in low-scoring thriller
description: Trent Rockets are crowned men's Hundred champions after beating Manchester Originals by two wickets in a thrilling final at Lord's.

title: Calais: Ferry companies apologise for long waits
description: Travellers returning home from their summer breaks in France report lengthy queues at the French port.

title: Family of Sikh priest attacked in Manchester appeal for help
description: CCTV showed the victim was assaulted by an unknown male and "left in a pool of blood", his family say.

title: Aston Villa 1-1 Manchester City: Champions miss chance to go top of table
description: Champions Manchester City miss chance to move top of the Premier League after Aston Villa fight back for draw.

title: Dutch Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton says Mercedes 'finally feels alive' after strong qualifying
description: Lewis Hamilton said his recalcitrant Mercedes "finally felt alive" in a Dutch Grand Prix qualifying session that delivered both frustration and promise.

title: Foo Fighters' Dave Grohl opens Taylor Hawkins tribute show
description: The Foo Fighters have been joined by Liam Gallagher in a special tribute to the band's late drummer.

title: US Open: Cameron Norrie reaches fourth round in New York
description: Cameron Norrie reaches the US Open fourth round for the first time with a composed victory over Denmark's 28th seed Holger Rune.

title: Crowds gather for the Braemar Highland games
description: It is the first time the event has been held since 2019 because of the Covid pandemic.

title: Chelsea 2-1 West Ham: David Moyes says VAR decision was 'scandalous'
description: West Ham manager David Moyes says the crucial VAR decision to deny his side a late equaliser against Chelsea was "scandalous".

title: The Hundred: Oval Invincibles beat Southern Brave to win second title
description: Oval Invincibles win the women's Hundred for the second year in a row with another victory over Southern Brave at Lord's.

title: Brentford 5-2 Leeds United: Ivan Toney passes 50 goals for Bees with stunning hat-trick
description: Ivan Toney scores a hat-trick as Brentford rise to seventh in the Premier League with an entertaining win over Leeds United.

title: England 52-14 United States: England win record 24th Test in a row
description: England claim a record-breaking 24th Test win in a row with a 52-14 World Cup warm-up victory against the United States.

title: What I'll be asking Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak on Sunday
description: Do the guests on my first Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg show have the answers to the UK's problems?

title: Chelsea 2-1 West Ham United: Blues come from behind to win
description: Substitute Kai Havertz scores a late winner as Chelsea come from behind to beat West Ham at Stamford Bridge.

title: Pilot circling US city threatens to crash on Walmart
description: Police in Tupelo, Mississippi say they have been in contact with the person flying the aircraft

title: Ukraine war: As UK counts pennies we count casualties - Olena Zelenska
description: Ukraine's first lady says it's important to keep highlighting the human cost of the war in her country.

title: Everton 0-0 Liverpool: Both sides hit woodwork in goalless draw
description: Everton and Liverpool fight out an action-packed Merseyside derby draw at Goodison Park.

title: Serena Williams - the woman who changed the game
description: Muhammad Ali and perhaps Billie Jean King aside, has any athlete made a greater impact on society than Serena Williams? And she may be only just beginning.

title: Clare Connor will not apply for ECB chief exec role
description: Former England captain Clare Connor says she will not be applying for the job as England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive on a permanent basis.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Funeral mourners asked to wear pink by family
description: Olivia Pratt-Korbel was shot after a gunman chased a man into her home in Liverpool in August.

title: US Open: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev cruises past Chinese qualifier Wu Yibing
description: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev sets up a fourth-round meeting with Australia's Nick Kyrgios with victory over Chinese qualifier Wu Yibing.

title: Serena Williams: Tributes paid to tennis' retiring great
description: Tributes are paid to Serena Williams, who has played her final match as a tennis professional after a US Open third-round defeat.

title: The Hundred: All you need to know about Saturday's finals at Lord's
description: Who is playing and who you should watch out for - BBC Sport previews Saturday's Hundred finals.

title: The Crown cast: Prince William and Kate Middleton actors revealed for season 6
description: The Netflix drama finds new actors to play the now-Duke and Duchess of Cambridge in the final series.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev: Last Soviet leader to be buried
description: But President Putin will not be attending the funeral of the man who oversaw the breakup of the USSR.

title: US Open: Serena Williams' career over after Ajla Tomljanovic defeat
description: Serena Williams waves farewell to the US Open - and her illustrious career - amid emotional scenes after she is beaten by Australia's Ajla Tomljanovic in New York.

title: Bus fare cap: England charges to be held at £2 for three months
description: The measure will run from January to March and cost £60m, the government announces.

title: Charity uses online returns to help hard-up families
description: Families have received hundreds of thousands of items of unwanted stock to help them during the cost of living crisis.

title: BBC exodus: What's behind the large number of presenters leaving?
description: A string of TV and radio hosts have left recently, but some argue it frees up room for new talent.

title: Cost of living: What do Covid, Ukraine and droughts have to do with my bills?
description: How Covid, Ukraine, climate change and relations with China are all pushing up prices.

title: Why the folding phone revolution has a way to go
description: After 13 months, technology editor Zoe Kleinman's Flip3 screen breaks, but can the concept live on?

title: Covid: Millions invited for booster jabs from Monday
description: Health bosses predict a resurgence of the virus and flu during the autumn and winter.
